entry.title: Glow
entry.content: I met Dominic who runs LuckyMe sometime around 2010. We both connected over our mutual admiration for Clipse and shortly afterwards he approached me to direct Lunice’s first music video. I knew I wanted to incorporate Lunice’s b-boy background I took incense and a video-projector into my closet. I projected my iTunes visualizer against the incense smoke to create a glowing palette. With my DSLR I photographed the projector light striking the incense. In post, I composited Lunice dancing directly on top of my glowing images. I believe I used a hard-light filter in Final Cut so the smoke seamlessly blended into Lunice’s body.

entry.title: Mike Slott
entry.content: Dom at LuckyMe introduced me to Mike and it felt like old souls reuniting. I was so grateful he opened his door to his home studio to me to share his insights on his recording process.

entry.title: Meet Us in Chinatown
entry.content: Jen at MeanRed & Katie at GoodPeoples invited me to spend a night photographing their 88 Palace party in Chinatown. What you see is what happens when a dim sum restaurant by day gets converted into a dancefloor at night.
